cont.entity_a: Signal strength reduces with walls between devices. Does not work with DSL modems. Works with cable internet connections. Cannot be used directly on a DSL modem.
cont.entity_b: Gateway to gateway VPNs drop regularly. Dual WAN option works sometimes, but not reliably. Load balancing works well if ISPs are stable. VPN and router features are available. Dual WAN function is helpful for redundant ISPs. VPN tunnels work well between small offices. Router has robust VPN capability and good firewall setup. Load balancing is effective for web surfing but has issues with secure connections. Device has a bandwidth management feature that can overburden the router. Does not work well with VoIP systems due to port issues.

cont.entity_a: Setup was easy, but shared mode connection issues due to DNS passthrough. Easy setup and use for creating a hotspot in hotels.
cont.entity_b: Easy to configure with a nice web interface. VPN setup is easy but has connection stability issues.

cont.entity_a: Router gets hot and should not be covered.
Not cheap. Good performance for the price paid.
Good for traveling and using in hotel rooms. Lightweight with its own carry case.
Customer support helped with installation issues.
cont.entity_b: Firmware upgrade support is available. Cisco support is not very helpful for resolving certain issues.

cont.entity_a: Stopped working after warranty expired. Requires daily reboot.
Difficult WEP configuration, but WPA configuration is quick.
cont.entity_b: Port forwarding has limitations, particularly with FTP in passive mode.
Not suitable for load-balancing multiple connections or managing VoIP traffic without an experienced engineer.
